problem_text: (F. Lisi, L. Sabatini). Let G be a non-trivial finite group and let p1, . . . , pk be the distinct prime divisors of |G|. For each i, let Hi be a Sylow pi-subgroup of G. Is it true that there exists an element x ∈ G such that for all i the subgroup Hi ∩ Hx_i is inclusion-minimal in {Hi ∩ Hg_i : g ∈ G}? T. C. Burness
